result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Richard Tomlinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon Richard Tomlinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon Richard Tomlinson was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Richard Tomlinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Judge George imposed loss of 5 days good time.
of Violation of JOC.

Defendant Brandon Richard Tomlinson in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1 with repeater enhancer dismissed.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Repeater dismissed.  Cts. 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 90 days jail with Huber work release, consecutive to any other sentence.  May serve sentence in Dane Cty with electronic monitoring.  $1083.00 fines and costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Bond on hand to be applied towards fines and costs.  Jail start 3/7/15 at 7:00 pm.  No jail credit due.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 12, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Affidavit of Mailing filed by the District Attorney's Office.
Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on January 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Preston Smead with repayment schedule

Court called 3:27pm. Defendant, Brandon Richard Tomlinson, appeared. Petition is reviewed. Court finds defendant conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Preston Smead. Def to pay $75/mo starting 5/15/14.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 09:10 am.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 02:45 pm. Case adjourned 3:37pm.
